Uses of Class
com.github.rwitzel.streamflyer.core.AfterModification

  • Packages that use AfterModification 
    Package Description
    com.github.rwitzel.streamflyer.core
    This package contains the public API of project streamflyer.
    com.github.rwitzel.streamflyer.regex
    This package contains the classes that are needed to apply regular expressions on character streams.
    com.github.rwitzel.streamflyer.regex.addons.nomatch  
    com.github.rwitzel.streamflyer.regex.addons.saxlike  
    com.github.rwitzel.streamflyer.util
    This package contains some classes that ease the use and extension of Streamflyer.
    com.github.rwitzel.streamflyer.util.statistics
    This package contains some classes that help you to identify the position in the stream the modifier is currently processing.
    com.github.rwitzel.streamflyer.xml
    This package contains some classes to deal with infamous XML streams that contain characters that are allowed in XML 1.1 but not XML 1.0.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      AfterModification Modifier.modify(StringBuilder characterBuffer, int firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer, boolean endOfStreamHit)
      Processes the characters in the given character buffer, i.e. deletes or replaces or inserts characters, or keeps the characters as they are.

    • Uses of AfterModification in com.github.rwitzel.streamflyer.util

      Methods in com.github.rwitzel.streamflyer.util that return AfterModification 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      AfterModification ModificationFactory.fetchMoreInput(int numberOfCharactersToSkip, StringBuilder characterBuffer, int firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer, boolean endOfStreamHit)
      This method skips the given characters to use the character buffer as optimal as possible, checks whether skipping and the current value of getNewNumberOfChars() would fetch more input in the character buffer.
      AfterModification ModificationFactory.modifyAgainImmediately(int newNumberOfChars_, int firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer)
      Use this method if you want to request another number of characters from the ModifyingReader and re-try a modification (MODIFY AGAIN IMMEDIATELY).
      AfterModification ModificationFactory.skip(int numberOfCharactersToSkip, StringBuilder characterBuffer, int firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer, boolean endOfStreamHit)
      Skips some characters if there are some in the buffer.
      AfterModification ModificationFactory.skipEntireBuffer(StringBuilder characterBuffer, int firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer, boolean endOfStreamHit) 
      AfterModification ModificationFactory.skipOrStop(int numberOfCharactersToSkip, StringBuilder characterBuffer, int firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer, boolean endOfStreamHit)
      Use this method if you either want to skip some characters (SKIP) or don't skip any characters as there are no modifiable characters in the buffer left but the end of stream is not hit (SKIP), or don't skip any characters as there are no modifiable characters in the buffer left and the end of stream is hit (STOP).
      AfterModification ModificationFactory.stop(StringBuilder characterBuffer, int firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer, boolean endOfStreamHit)
